Banks posted record years through M&A...

title: 12 Predictions for 2026
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fthreadreaderapp.com%2Fthread%2F2003249842127057262.html%3Futm_source=tldrcrypto/1/0100019b4b5d1f77-62841387-47dc-4075-918e-02484c39493b-000000/-UfnV1WJj2MlbWJRGaA_3sNvYXnKLkeCdXE0lfJbrWY=436
summary: 12 Predictions for 2026 (3 minute read) 2026 will be defined by AI agents becoming “more expensive than people” in business, a major liquidity/IPO + M&A comeback, and the stack evolving toward long-horizon autonomous agents (8+ hour workstreams), agent observability, and agent-driven database stress. On crypto, 30% of international payments will be issued via stablecoins by December, and Cloudflare will become a gatekeeper for agentic payments via the x402/HTTP 402 Payment Required pattern.

title: SSH server Dropbear allows privilege escalation
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.heise.de%2Fen%2Fnews%2FSSH-server-Dropbear-allows-privilege-escalation-11119397.html%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/Q7M3PcPD-fy5mH7ukABs25HOs109EKVCJ09KtyfksJ8=437
summary: SSH server Dropbear allows privilege escalation (2 minute read) Dropbear SSH server versions through 2024.84 contain CVE-2025-14282 (CVSS 9.8 Critical), which allows privilege escalation to root via Unix socket forwarding. Programs that authenticate forwarded connections, by misusing SO_PEERCRED, receive root credentials instead of the actual user's credentials. Dropbear 2025.89 fixes this by implementing comprehensive changes to Unix socket handling and disabling socket forwarding when force...

title: 1,000 computers taken offline in Romanian water management authority hack — ransomware takes Bitlocker-encrypted systems down
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.tomshardware.com%2Ftech-industry%2Fcyber-security%2F1-000-computers-taken-offline-in-romanian-water-management-authority-hack-ransomware-takes-bitlocker-encrypted-systems-down%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/ApCnRN8jZHznCmnIT0Qyi7zYDT5NBWZQbzwkgIC7wjo=437
summary: 1,000 computers taken offline in Romanian water management authority hack — ransomware takes Bitlocker-encrypted systems down (2 minute read) Romanian water authorities suffered a ransomware attack that encrypted systems using BitLocker and disabled about 1,000 computers across 10 of 11 regional offices. Core IT services, such as email, web platforms, databases, and GIS, were impacted, though the water supply continued.

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.koi.ai%2Fblog%2Fnpm-package-with-56k-downloads-malware-stealing-whatsapp-messages%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/6QkE6VwYOPmKEA41Ewnrz7N6YACKwFsAaWy8ngQ5dwo=437
summary: NPM Package With 56K Downloads Caught Stealing WhatsApp Messages (7 minute read) The lotusbail npm package masqueraded as a legitimate WhatsApp Web API fork with functional code while secretly intercepting authentication tokens, messages, contacts, and media files through a malicious WebSocket wrapper. The malware employed sophisticated evasion techniques, including custom RSA encryption, four-layer obfuscation, 27 anti-debugging traps, and a hardcoded pairing code that established persistent...

title: Vulnhalla: Picking the true vulnerabilities from the CodeQL haystack
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.cyberark.com%2Fresources%2Fthreat-research-blog%2Fvulnhalla-picking-the-true-vulnerabilities-from-the-codeql-haystack%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/XGIQrsKxPAIFmLu-9ep9pUh01bjVHbFuG5EO9tto0GM=437
summary: Vulnhalla: Picking the true vulnerabilities from the CodeQL haystack (10 minute read) Modern vulnerability research can blend static analysis with large language models to cut through overwhelming false positives and highlight only issues that look genuinely exploitable. title: Docker Hardened Images for Free
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.docker.com%2Fproducts%2Fhardened-images%2F%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/9LQbHHAYs2PAvBdWgJDVR-jVZlbOyZ8m_GTXmCvXpd0=437
summary: Docker Hardened Images for Free (Product Launch) Docker has released over 1,000 secure images that are free and open source for developers. These images are regularly scanned and updated to minimize or eliminate exploitable CVEs. They run as non-root by default, are minimal to lower the attack surface, meet compliance standards, and are available across multiple distributions.

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 6 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.theregister.com%2F2025%2F12%2F22%2Fhacktivists_scrape_songs_spotify%2F%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019b4b895ff1-3c8ed5b5-c343-43bc-9de2-1812716961f3-000000/-YzLjeVb8AlXzKjjYVOd_FIXgkuAG5-M_-fqZ3oiMxQ=437

summary: South Korea to require facial recognition for new mobile numbers (2 minute read) South Korea plans to require facial recognition when people sign up for new mobile numbers, matching ID photos with real-time images to block phones registered under false identities. The rule, which applies to major carriers and virtual operators, starts on March 23. Authorities hope to curb widespread voice phishing scams and address security weaknesses exposed by a massive SK Telecom data breach that affected ...

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2F3lF8cQ/1/0100019b4b924458-2d845cd0-5afb-4732-ab94-fb15a2c8e6ca-000000/73jDQgcwiAVJdFAZY9UaJJ8Dr8Scw75IRpOTJRihQKc=436
summary: Your Year with ChatGPT (2 minute read) OpenAI introduced a personalized year-in-review feature called "Your Year with ChatGPT," available to eligible users in select regions. Inspired by Spotify Wrapped, the feature highlights individual usage trends from the past year.

title: Z.AI launches GLM-4.7, new SOTA open-source model for coding
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FkZtPyd/1/0100019b4b924458-2d845cd0-5afb-4732-ab94-fb15a2c8e6ca-000000/-mGgmpyXf8-Sw88sflmBaeHEPt6ZvszEnYP7bUAtgQs=436
summary: Z.AI launches GLM-4.7, new SOTA open-source model for coding (2 minute read) GLM-4.7 is the latest release in Z.AI's General Language Model line. The high-end foundation model is aimed at advanced reasoning, coding, and multimodal workloads. The late update expands context handling and reasoning depth compared to earlier versions. It introduced upgraded reasoning pipelines and broader multimodal support.

title: MiniMax M2.1 is live in Kilo
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.kilo.ai%2Fp%2Fminimax-m21%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019b4b924458-2d845cd0-5afb-4732-ab94-fb15a2c8e6ca-000000/uc2J5Fg7tBf_jIUAEBbkSlamc1ctKOe1EbpUBhWyLrs=436
summary: MiniMax M2.1 is live in Kilo (3 minute read) MiniMax M2.1 is ahead of DeepSeek and Kimi on several benchmarks. It is even catching up to state-of-the-art models in some areas. The model is super-fast and efficient. It is now available to all Kilo Code users.

title: Introducing Manus Design View
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-23, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fmanus.im%2Fblog%2Fmanus-design-view%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019b4b924458-2d845cd0-5afb-4732-ab94-fb15a2c8e6ca-000000/VJGYN_mmjbsHGe5xZNQGImlgz_XY9OGEG9PxgUXUaek=436
summary: Introducing Manus Design View (3 minute read) Manus Design View is an extension of the Manus agent for seamless AI design workflows. It enables designers to generate concepts with simple prompts, make precise edits using the Mark Tool, and change text easily. The Manus mobile app allows design edits on-the-go with either text or voice input. It is available to all users today.
